noun.description: A middleman operating between the producers and the wholesalers in the nail and chain making industries. Now historical.

origin: Mid 16th century (in an earlier sense). Probably from Fogger, former spelling in English texts of Fugger, the surname of a family of wealthy mercantile bankers and venture capitalists from Augsburg, Germany, in the 15th and 16th centuries<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Hughes (1822–1896), social reformer and children's writer. Apparently from fog + -er<br>late 19th century (in an earlier sense). From fog + -er.
